titles.title: A bill to transfer functions of the Temporary Emergency Court of Appeals and to abolish such court.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.

bill.summary: 5/6/1987--Introduced. Abolishes the Temporary Emergency Court of Appeals, effective September 30, 1988. Amends the Economic Stabilization Act of 1970, the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978, and the Federal judicial code to transfer the functions of such court to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Federal Circuit.
